metadata.description: CHR-35: Medieval Europe historical figures (500-1500 CE) - Phase 1 with 52 figures covering monarchs, religious leaders, military figures, scholars, and notable women

figures.name: Richard I of England
figures.title: King of England
figures.description: Richard the Lionheart, King of England and renowned Crusader warrior, known for his military leadership during the Third Crusade

figures.name: William the Conqueror
figures.title: King of England, Duke of Normandy
figures.description: First Norman King of England, victor of the Battle of Hastings (1066) who fundamentally transformed English society

figures.name: Joan of Arc
figures.title: Military Leader, Saint
figures.description: French peasant girl who led French forces during the Hundred Years' War and was later canonized as a Catholic saint

figures.name: Eleanor of Aquitaine
figures.title: Queen consort of France and England, Duchess of Aquitaine
figures.description: One of the most powerful women in Medieval Europe, queen consort of both France and England

figures.name: Henry II of England
figures.title: King of England
figures.description: First Plantagenet king of England, established legal reforms and controlled the vast Angevin Empire

figures.name: Edward I of England
figures.title: King of England
figures.description: Known as the 'Hammer of the Scots', conquered Wales and attempted to subdue Scotland

figures.name: Edward II of England
figures.title: King of England
figures.description: Controversial English king, deposed by his wife Isabella and Roger Mortimer

figures.name: Edward III of England
figures.title: King of England
figures.description: Initiated the Hundred Years' War, founder of the Order of the Garter, one of England's most successful medieval monarchs

figures.name: Edward the Black Prince
figures.title: Prince of Wales
figures.description: Eldest son of Edward III, distinguished military commander at Crécy and Poitiers

figures.name: Henry V of England
figures.title: King of England
figures.description: Victor of Agincourt (1415), nearly succeeded in uniting the English and French crowns

figures.name: Philip II Augustus
figures.title: King of France
figures.description: Significantly expanded French royal domains and participated in the Third Crusade

figures.name: Louis IX of France
figures.title: King of France, Saint
figures.description: Saint Louis, led two Crusades and known for justice and piety, only French king to be canonized

figures.name: Charlemagne
figures.title: Holy Roman Emperor, King of the Franks
figures.description: Father of Europe, united much of Western and Central Europe, crowned Holy Roman Emperor in 800

figures.name: Frederick I Barbarossa
figures.title: Holy Roman Emperor
figures.description: Powerful Holy Roman Emperor, drowned during the Third Crusade, legendary figure in German history

figures.name: Otto I the Great
figures.title: Holy Roman Emperor
figures.description: First great ruler of the medieval German state, defeated the Magyars at Lechfeld

figures.name: Saladin
figures.title: Sultan of Egypt and Syria
figures.description: Founder of the Ayyubid dynasty, reconquered Jerusalem from the Crusaders in 1187

figures.name: Godfrey of Bouillon
figures.title: Defender of the Holy Sepulchre
figures.description: Leader of the First Crusade, first ruler of the Kingdom of Jerusalem

figures.name: Harald Hardrada
figures.title: King of Norway
figures.description: Last great Viking warrior king, died at the Battle of Stamford Bridge attempting to claim the English throne

figures.name: Cnut the Great
figures.title: King of England, Denmark, and Norway
figures.description: Created the North Sea Empire, ruling England, Denmark, and Norway simultaneously

figures.name: Thomas Aquinas
figures.title: Theologian, Philosopher, Doctor of the Church
figures.description: Dominican friar and immensely influential philosopher, synthesized Aristotelian philosophy with Christian theology

figures.name: Thomas Becket
figures.title: Archbishop of Canterbury, Saint
figures.description: Murdered in Canterbury Cathedral after conflict with Henry II, became a martyr and saint

figures.name: Pope Urban II
figures.title: Pope
figures.description: Called for the First Crusade at the Council of Clermont in 1095

figures.name: Pope Innocent III
figures.title: Pope
figures.description: Most powerful medieval pope, called the Fourth Crusade and Fourth Lateran Council

figures.name: Pope Gregory VII
figures.title: Pope
figures.description: Central figure in the Investiture Controversy with Emperor Henry IV, reformed the papacy

figures.name: Francis of Assisi
figures.title: Saint, Founder of Franciscan Order
figures.description: Founded the Franciscan Order, known for devotion to poverty and nature, one of Christianity's most beloved saints

figures.name: Constantine XI Palaiologos
figures.title: Byzantine Emperor
figures.description: Last Byzantine Emperor, died defending Constantinople from the Ottoman conquest in 1453

figures.name: Justinian I
figures.title: Byzantine Emperor
figures.description: Greatest Byzantine emperor, codified Roman law (Corpus Juris Civilis), built Hagia Sophia

figures.name: Alfred the Great
figures.title: King of Wessex
figures.description: Defended England against Viking invasions, promoted education and law, only English king called 'the Great'

figures.name: John of England
figures.title: King of England
figures.description: Forced to sign Magna Carta (1215), lost most English possessions in France

figures.name: Henry III of England
figures.title: King of England
figures.description: Long-reigning English king, faced baronial rebellion led by Simon de Montfort

figures.name: Henry VI of England
figures.title: King of England
figures.description: Lancastrian king during Wars of the Roses, suffered from mental illness, deposed twice

figures.name: Richard III of England
figures.title: King of England
figures.description: Last Plantagenet and Yorkist king, killed at Bosworth Field ending the Wars of the Roses

figures.name: William Wallace
figures.title: Scottish Knight and Guardian
figures.description: Led Scottish resistance against Edward I, executed for high treason, national hero of Scotland

figures.name: Robert the Bruce
figures.title: King of Scots
figures.description: Led Scotland to independence from England, victor at Bannockburn (1314)

figures.name: Isabella of France
figures.title: Queen of England
figures.description: She-Wolf of France, deposed her husband Edward II with lover Roger Mortimer

figures.name: Hildegard of Bingen
figures.title: Abbess, Mystic, Composer
figures.description: German Benedictine abbess, writer, composer, philosopher, mystic, and polymath

figures.name: Dante Alighieri
figures.title: Poet
figures.description: Italian poet, author of the Divine Comedy, father of the Italian language

figures.name: Geoffrey Chaucer
figures.title: Poet
figures.description: Author of The Canterbury Tales, father of English literature

figures.name: Marco Polo
figures.title: Merchant, Explorer
figures.description: Venetian merchant and explorer, traveled extensively in Asia and met Kublai Khan

figures.name: Genghis Khan
figures.title: Khan of the Mongol Empire
figures.description: Founder and first Great Khan of the Mongol Empire, created the largest contiguous land empire in history

figures.name: Kublai Khan
figures.title: Great Khan, Emperor of Yuan Dynasty
figures.description: Grandson of Genghis Khan, founded the Yuan Dynasty in China, hosted Marco Polo

figures.name: William Marshal
figures.title: Knight, Earl of Pembroke
figures.description: Greatest knight of the Middle Ages, served four English kings, regent for Henry III

figures.name: El Cid
figures.title: Castilian Knight
figures.description: Rodrigo Díaz de Vivar, legendary Castilian military leader during the Reconquista

figures.name: Bohemond I of Antioch
figures.title: Prince of Antioch
figures.description: Norman crusader leader, founded the Principality of Antioch during the First Crusade

figures.name: Baldwin IV of Jerusalem
figures.title: King of Jerusalem
figures.description: The Leper King, ruled Crusader Jerusalem despite suffering from leprosy, successfully defended against Saladin

figures.name: Peter Abelard
figures.title: Philosopher, Theologian
figures.description: Medieval French scholastic philosopher, known for tragic romance with Héloïse

figures.name: Bernard of Clairvaux
figures.title: Abbot, Doctor of the Church
figures.description: Cistercian monk and mystic, preached the Second Crusade, influential church reformer

figures.name: Frederick II, Holy Roman Emperor
figures.title: Holy Roman Emperor, King of Sicily
figures.description: Stupor Mundi (Wonder of the World), polyglot patron of science and arts, led the Sixth Crusade

figures.name: Matilda of Tuscany
figures.title: Countess of Tuscany
figures.description: Powerful Italian noblewoman, supported Pope Gregory VII during Investiture Controversy

figures.name: Henry IV, Holy Roman Emperor
figures.title: Holy Roman Emperor
figures.description: Central figure in Investiture Controversy, famously did penance at Canossa before Pope Gregory VII

figures.name: Alexios I Komnenos
figures.title: Byzantine Emperor
figures.description: Byzantine emperor who requested Western aid, indirectly prompting the First Crusade

figures.name: Christine de Pizan
figures.title: Writer, Poet
figures.description: First professional female writer in Europe, early feminist, author of The Book of the City of Ladies

figures.name: Vlad the Impaler
figures.title: Prince of Wallachia
figures.description: Voivode of Wallachia, known for extreme cruelty, inspiration for Dracula legend
